_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Kinder Morgan Liquids Terminals LLC (KMLT) - BOSTCO Terminal is an on-shore, heavy products storage and distribution facility that includes propylene operations. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the Refinery Grade Propylene (RGP) railcar offloading/loading process including four (4) railcar offloading/loading spots, a vapor compressor, liquid pump, flow meters, piping and appurtenances, and track space to store a maximum of 36 RGP railcars. RGP is offloaded into and loaded from DOT regulated onsite pipeline breakout tanks (not regulated by RMP). 



The RGP railcar offloading/loading process was constructed in accordance with American Petroleum Industry Code #2510 (Design and Construction of LPG Installations) and it is the Facility's policy to follow the most current future editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws. In addition, BOSTO Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard and associated 14 elements (29 CFR Part 1910.119), and all applicable state and local laws and regulations.



This facility has not had an accident involving RGP which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



BOSTCO Terminal maintains an Emergency Response Action Plan (ERAP) that has been updated to include the RGP system. Employees are adequately trained and prepared to respond to emergencies. Training includes Emergency Response (HAZMAT), Emergency Action and Fire Prevention, Accidental Release Prevention, Environmental Awareness, and Terminal Safety Systems. Emergency Response Team (ERT) members also attend fire school at the Refinery Terminal Fire Company in Corpus Christi, TX. 



Finally, the facility prepares for emergencies by conducting quarterly notification drills, annual exercise

s, and participates in area-wide drills that are conducted in conducted in conjunction with governmental agencies and Channel Industries Mutual Aid (CIMA).  



BOSTCO Terminal actively seeks employee input on process safety improvements. Additionally, the La Porte Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
